h1: How Many Calories Are in a Strip Steak?
assumptions: Grilled New York strip steak, lean only, trimmed of visible fat, 8 oz (227 g) cooked serving.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, fat content, cooking method, and portion size. Check labels or sources for exact values.

quick_answer.text: A typical 8 oz grilled strip steak provides ~479 kcal and ~68 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Pan-seared with 1 tsp oil per steak
Include some fat trim (vs. lean only)

faqs.q: How many calories are in a strip steak?
faqs.a: About 479 kcal for an 8 oz grilled, lean strip steak.

faqs.q: How much protein in a strip steak?
faqs.a: Roughly 68 g protein in an 8 oz serving.

faqs.q: Is strip steak high in fat?
faqs.a: Lean cuts have ~23 g total fat per 8 oz; choose trimmed for lower fat.

faqs.q: Calories in raw vs. cooked strip steak?
faqs.a: Raw is lower (~140 kcal/100 g); cooking concentrates nutrients as water evaporates.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in strip steak?
faqs.a: Yes—grilling keeps it lower; frying or butter-basting adds 40–100 kcal per steak.
